Ingredients: 400g spaghetti, 200g guanciale or pancetta, 4 large eggs, 100g Pecorino Romano cheese (grated), freshly ground black pepper, salt
Instructions: 1. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti until al dente. 2. Cut guanciale into small cubes and cook in a large pan until crispy. 3. Beat eggs with grated Pecorino and black pepper in a bowl. 4. Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup pasta water. 5. Add hot pasta to pan with guanciale. Remove from heat. 6. Quickly mix in egg mixture, adding pasta water as needed to create creamy sauce. 7. Serve immediately with extra Pecorino and pepper.
Notes: Never add cream to authentic Carbonara. The creaminess comes from the eggs and cheese.

Ingredients: 300g pizza dough, 200g San Marzano tomatoes (crushed), 200g fresh mozzarella, fresh basil leaves, extra virgin olive oil, salt
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 250°C (482°F). 2. Roll out pizza dough on floured surface. 3. Spread crushed tomatoes evenly, leaving 2cm border. 4. Add torn mozzarella pieces. 5. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. 6. Bake 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly. 7. Top with fresh basil leaves before serving.
Notes: Use the best quality San Marzano tomatoes and fresh mozzarella for authentic taste.

Ingredients: 320g Arborio rice, 1L beef or vegetable stock, 1 onion (finely chopped), 100ml dry white wine, pinch of saffron, 50g butter, 80g Parmigiano-Reggiano (grated), salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Heat stock in a saucepan, add saffron and keep warm. 2. Melt half the butter in heavy-bottomed pan, sauté onion until translucent. 3. Add rice, stir 2 minutes until coated. 4. Add wine, stir until absorbed. 5. Add warm stock one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed before adding more. 6. Continue for 18-20 minutes until rice is creamy but al dente. 7. Remove from heat, stir in remaining butter and Parmigiano. 8. Season and serve immediately.
Notes: Stir constantly and be patient. The rice should be creamy outside but still have a slight bite.

Ingredients: 6 egg yolks, 75g sugar, 500g mascarpone, 3 egg whites, 300ml strong coffee (cooled), 3 tbsp coffee liqueur (optional), 2 packets ladyfinger cookies, unsweetened cocoa powder
Instructions: 1. Whisk egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale. 2. Add mascarpone and beat until smooth. 3. In separate bowl, whisk egg whites to soft peaks. 4. Gently fold egg whites into mascarpone mixture. 5. Combine coffee and liqueur in shallow dish. 6. Quickly dip each ladyfinger in coffee mixture and arrange in single layer in dish. 7. Spread half the mascarpone mixture over cookies. 8. Repeat layers. 9. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. 10. Dust with cocoa before serving.
Notes: Use fresh eggs from a trusted source since they're raw. Chill overnight for best results.

Ingredients: 4 veal shanks (cross-cut), flour for dusting, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 onion (diced), 1 carrot (diced), 1 celery stalk (diced), 2 cloves garlic (minced), 1 cup dry white wine, 400g canned tomatoes, beef stock, bay leaves, thyme, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Season veal shanks and dust with flour. 2. Heat oil in heavy casserole, brown shanks on all sides. Remove and set aside. 3. Add vegetables to same pan, cook until softened. 4. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. 5. Return veal to pan, add wine and let reduce. 6. Add tomatoes, herbs, and enough stock to barely cover meat. 7. Cover and braise in 160°C oven for 2-2.5 hours until meat is fork-tender. 8. Serve with risotto Milanese or polenta.
Notes: Traditional accompaniment is risotto Milanese. The marrow in the bone is a delicacy.

Ingredients: 4 slices rustic bread, 4 ripe tomatoes (diced), 2 cloves garlic, fresh basil leaves, extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper, balsamic vinegar (optional)
Instructions: 1. Grill or toast bread slices until golden. 2. Rub one side of each slice with garlic clove. 3. Mix diced tomatoes with torn basil, olive oil, salt, and pepper. 4. Let tomato mixture sit 10 minutes to develop flavors. 5. Top bread with tomato mixture just before serving.
Notes: Serve immediately after topping to prevent bread from getting soggy.

Ingredients: 500g ground beef, 200g ground pork, 1 onion (diced), 2 carrots (diced), 2 celery stalks (diced), 800g canned tomatoes, 500ml red wine, 500ml beef stock, 500g lasagna sheets, 1L béchamel sauce, 200g Parmigiano-Reggiano, olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Make Bolognese: sauté vegetables in oil, add meat and brown. Add wine, tomatoes, and stock. Simmer 2-3 hours. 2. Cook lasagna sheets until al dente. 3. Layer in baking dish: Bolognese, pasta, béchamel, cheese. Repeat 3-4 times. 4. Top with béchamel and cheese. 5. Bake at 180°C for 45 minutes until golden.
Notes: Let rest 15 minutes before cutting. Can be made a day ahead and reheated.

Ingredients: 50g fresh basil leaves, 2 cloves garlic, 30g pine nuts, 50g Parmigiano-Reggiano (grated), 30g Pecorino Romano (grated), 120ml extra virgin olive oil, coarse salt
Instructions: 1. Wash and dry basil leaves completely. 2. In mortar and pestle (traditional method), crush garlic with salt. 3. Add basil leaves gradually, crushing to release oils. 4. Add pine nuts and crush. 5. Add cheeses and mix. 6. Slowly drizzle in olive oil while mixing until smooth paste forms. 7. Alternatively, use food processor but pulse briefly to avoid heating.
Notes: Never heat pesto. Always use Ligurian basil if possible. Store covered with olive oil.

Ingredients: 200g cannellini beans (soaked overnight), 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 onion (diced), 2 carrots (diced), 2 celery stalks (diced), 2 zucchini (diced), 200g green beans (chopped), 400g canned tomatoes, 1.5L vegetable stock, 100g ditalini pasta, fresh basil, Parmigiano-Reggiano, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Cook soaked beans until tender. 2. Heat oil in large pot, sauté onion, carrots, celery until soft. 3. Add zucchini and green beans, cook 5 minutes. 4. Add tomatoes, cooked beans, and stock. 5. Simmer 20 minutes. 6. Add pasta and cook until al dente. 7. Season with salt and pepper. 8. Serve with basil and grated Parmigiano.
Notes: Vegetables can vary by season. Some regions add a soffritto base of garlic, herbs, and pancetta.

Ingredients: 500ml whole milk, 200ml heavy cream, 150g sugar, 6 egg yolks, 2 vanilla beans (or 2 tsp vanilla extract), pinch of salt
Instructions: 1. Split vanilla beans and scrape seeds into milk with cream in saucepan. Add bean pods. 2. Heat until just beginning to simmer. 3. Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale. 4. Gradually add hot milk mixture to yolks, whisking constantly. 5. Return to pan and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture coats spoon (80°C). 6. Strain and cool completely. 7. Churn in ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions. 8. Freeze until firm.
Notes: Gelato has less air than ice cream, making it denser and more flavorful.

Ingredients: 400g Arborio rice, 1L chicken stock, 100g Parmigiano-Reggiano, 2 eggs, 200g mozzarella (cubed), 100g peas, 100g ground meat (optional), flour, breadcrumbs, oil for frying
Instructions: 1. Make risotto with rice and stock, cool completely. 2. Mix in Parmigiano and 1 egg. 3. Take handful of rice, make well in center, add mozzarella cube and peas (and meat if using). 4. Shape into ball, ensuring filling is enclosed. 5. Roll in flour, beaten egg, then breadcrumbs. 6. Deep fry at 170°C until golden brown. 7. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
Notes: Can be made ahead and reheated. Originally a way to use leftover risotto.

Ingredients: 8-12 thin slices Prosciutto di Parma, 1 ripe cantaloupe melon, freshly ground black pepper (optional)
Instructions: 1. Cut melon into wedges, remove seeds and rind. 2. Arrange melon on serving plate. 3. Drape prosciutto slices over melon. 4. Serve immediately with optional black pepper.
Notes: Choose very ripe melon for best contrast with salty prosciutto. Never add salt.

Ingredients: 400g tonnarelli or spaghetti, 200g Pecorino Romano (finely grated), freshly ground black pepper, salt
Instructions: 1. Cook pasta in salted water until just shy of al dente. 2. Meanwhile, toast black pepper in dry pan. 3. In large bowl, mix grated Pecorino with pepper and small amount of pasta water to form paste. 4. Drain pasta, reserving cooking water. 5. Add pasta to cheese mixture with more pasta water as needed, tossing vigorously to create creamy sauce. 6. Serve immediately with extra pepper and cheese.
Notes: The key is the pasta water - it creates the creamy emulsion. No oil or butter needed.

Ingredients: 500ml heavy cream, 80g sugar, 1 packet gelatin (7g), 3 tbsp water, 1 vanilla bean or 1 tsp vanilla extract
Instructions: 1. Sprinkle gelatin over cold water, let bloom 5 minutes. 2. Heat cream with sugar and vanilla until sugar dissolves. 3. Remove from heat, add bloomed gelatin and stir until dissolved. 4. Strain mixture and divide among 6 ramekins. 5. Refrigerate at least 4 hours until set. 6. Serve with berry coulis or caramel sauce.
Notes: Can be made 2 days ahead. Serve with fresh berries or fruit compote.

Ingredients: 4 veal cutlets (pounded thin), 4 slices prosciutto, 8 sage leaves, 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp butter, 100ml dry white wine, salt, pepper, toothpicks
Instructions: 1. Season veal with salt and pepper. 2. Top each cutlet with prosciutto slice and 2 sage leaves. Secure with toothpick. 3. Heat oil and butter in large pan. 4. Cook veal prosciutto-side down first, 3-4 minutes. Flip and cook 2-3 minutes more. 5. Remove veal, deglaze pan with wine. 6. Return veal to pan briefly to coat with sauce. 7. Remove toothpicks and serve immediately.
Notes: Saltimbocca means 'jumps in the mouth' - it should be served immediately for best taste.

Ingredients: 1kg potato gnocchi, 400g San Marzano tomatoes (crushed), 200g fresh mozzarella (cubed), 50g Parmigiano-Reggiano (grated), fresh basil, 3 cloves garlic, olive oil, salt
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil, sauté garlic until fragrant. 2. Add crushed tomatoes, cook 15 minutes until thickened. Season with salt. 3. Cook gnocchi in salted boiling water until they float. 4. Add gnocchi to tomato sauce with mozzarella cubes. 5. Transfer to baking dish, top with Parmigiano and torn basil. 6. Bake at 200°C for 10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Notes: Can be made with homemade or store-bought gnocchi. The key is not to overcook the gnocchi.

Ingredients: 1kg veal roast, 200g canned tuna, 4 anchovy fillets, 3 egg yolks, 200ml olive oil, 2 tbsp capers, juice of 1 lemon, 1 carrot, 1 onion, 1 celery stalk, white wine, bay leaves
Instructions: 1. Roast veal with vegetables and wine until tender, cool completely. 2. Make tonnato sauce: blend tuna, anchovies, egg yolks, slowly adding oil to make mayonnaise consistency. 3. Add lemon juice and some cooking liquid to thin. 4. Slice veal thinly, arrange on platter. 5. Cover with tonnato sauce and capers. 6. Chill overnight before serving.
Notes: A classic summer dish from Piedmont. The veal should be served cold.

Ingredients: 400g cannellini beans (dried), 1 bunch kale, 1 bunch Swiss chard, 1 onion, 2 carrots, 2 celery stalks, 4 tomatoes, 4 slices stale bread, olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Soak beans overnight, cook until tender. 2. Sauté onion, carrots, celery in oil. 3. Add tomatoes, cook 10 minutes. 4. Add greens and beans with cooking liquid. 5. Simmer 30 minutes. 6. Layer bread and soup in pot, let rest overnight. 7. Reheat next day (ribollita means 'reboiled'). 8. Serve with olive oil drizzle.
Notes: Better the next day - the bread thickens the soup. Traditional peasant dish from Tuscany.

Ingredients: 300g flour, 30g sugar, 30g butter, 1 egg, 2 tbsp white wine, pinch salt, oil for frying, 500g ricotta, 200g powdered sugar, chocolate chips, candied fruit, pistachios
Instructions: 1. Make dough with flour, sugar, butter, egg, wine, and salt. Rest 1 hour. 2. Roll very thin, cut circles, wrap around cannoli tubes. 3. Fry in hot oil until golden, cool on tubes. 4. Mix ricotta with powdered sugar for filling. 5. Fill shells just before serving to keep crispy. 6. Garnish ends with chocolate chips or pistachios.
Notes: Never fill shells ahead of time - they'll get soggy. Authentic Sicilian ricotta is key.

Ingredients: 4 veal shanks, flour, butter, 1 onion, 1 carrot, 1 celery stalk, white wine, beef stock, tomatoes, gremolata (lemon zest, garlic, parsley)
Instructions: 1. Dust veal shanks with flour, brown in butter. 2. Add diced vegetables, cook until soft. 3. Add wine, let reduce. 4. Add tomatoes and stock, cover and braise 2 hours. 5. Make gremolata by mixing lemon zest, minced garlic, and parsley. 6. Serve with gremolata and risotto.
Notes: Gremolata is the traditional garnish that brightens the rich dish.

Ingredients: 500g bread flour, 10g fresh yeast, 350ml warm water, 100ml olive oil, 10g salt, coarse sea salt, rosemary
Instructions: 1. Dissolve yeast in warm water. 2. Mix flour with dissolved yeast, half the oil, and salt. 3. Knead until smooth, let rise 2 hours. 4. Oil baking pan generously. 5. Stretch dough to fit pan, dimple with fingers. 6. Brush with remaining oil, sprinkle with coarse salt and rosemary. 7. Let rise 1 hour. 8. Bake at 220°C for 20-25 minutes until golden.
Notes: The key is lots of olive oil and proper fermentation for the characteristic holes.

Ingredients: 3 large eggplants, 500ml tomato sauce, 400g mozzarella (sliced), 150g Parmigiano-Reggiano (grated), fresh basil, flour, eggs, olive oil, salt
Instructions: 1. Slice eggplants 1cm thick, salt and let drain 30 minutes. 2. Pat dry, dust with flour, dip in beaten eggs. 3. Fry until golden on both sides. 4. Layer in baking dish: tomato sauce, eggplant, mozzarella, Parmigiano, basil. Repeat layers. 5. Top with cheese and bake at 180°C for 30 minutes until bubbly. 6. Let rest 10 minutes before serving.
Notes: Some versions use breadcrumbs. Origin disputed between Sicily and Campania.

Ingredients: 300g polenta (cornmeal), 1.2L water, 200g mixed mountain cheeses (Taleggio, Gorgonzola), 100g butter, salt
Instructions: 1. Bring salted water to boil in heavy-bottomed pot. 2. Gradually whisk in polenta to prevent lumps. 3. Cook 45 minutes, stirring constantly with wooden spoon. 4. Stir in cheeses and butter until melted. 5. Serve immediately while hot and creamy.
Notes: Traditional dish from Valtellina. The constant stirring is essential for smooth texture.

Ingredients: 300g leftover spaghetti, 6 eggs, 100g Parmigiano-Reggiano (grated), 100g mozzarella (cubed), olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Beat eggs with grated Parmigiano, salt, and pepper. 2. Mix in cold leftover pasta and mozzarella cubes. 3. Heat oil in non-stick pan. 4. Pour in mixture, cook 8-10 minutes until bottom is set. 5. Flip or finish under broiler to cook top. 6. Serve hot or at room temperature.
Notes: Great way to use leftover pasta. Popular in Naples as street food.

Ingredients: 2 eggplants (diced), 3 tomatoes (diced), 1 onion (sliced), 2 celery stalks (diced), 100g green olives, 3 tbsp capers, 3 tbsp pine nuts, 100ml red wine vinegar, 2 tbsp sugar, olive oil, salt
Instructions: 1. Fry diced eggplant until golden, drain on paper towels. 2. Sauté onion and celery until soft. 3. Add tomatoes, cook 10 minutes. 4. Add olives, capers, pine nuts, eggplant. 5. Mix vinegar and sugar, add to pan. 6. Simmer 15 minutes. 7. Serve at room temperature.
Notes: Sicilian sweet and sour vegetable stew. Better after resting overnight.

Ingredients: 8 Roman artichokes, 2 lemons, olive oil for frying, garlic, parsley, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Clean artichokes, remove tough outer leaves. 2. Flatten by pressing down. 3. Soak in lemon water 30 minutes. 4. Fry in hot oil until tender and crispy outside. 5. Season with salt, pepper, garlic, and parsley. 6. Serve immediately while hot.
Notes: Jewish-Roman recipe. Artichokes should be very tender when done.

Ingredients: 500g salt cod (soaked 48 hours), 200ml olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, parsley, lemon juice, white pepper
Instructions: 1. Boil soaked cod until tender, remove skin and bones. 2. Flake fish finely. 3. Gradually whip in olive oil until creamy. 4. Add minced garlic, parsley, lemon juice. 5. Season with white pepper. 6. Serve on toasted polenta or bread.
Notes: Traditional Venetian appetizer. Must be whipped to achieve creamy texture.

Ingredients: 300g risotto rice, 1L beef stock, 100g Parmigiano, 200g mozzarella (cubed), 2 eggs, breadcrumbs, oil for frying
Instructions: 1. Make risotto with rice and stock, cool completely. 2. Mix in Parmigiano and 1 egg. 3. Form balls around mozzarella cubes. 4. Roll in beaten egg then breadcrumbs. 5. Fry until golden. 6. Serve hot.
Notes: Roman street food. Name comes from cheese strings resembling telephone wires.

Ingredients: 400g rigatoni, 2 eggplants (cubed), 400g tomato sauce, 150g ricotta salata (grated), fresh basil, olive oil, garlic, salt
Instructions: 1. Cube and salt eggplant, let drain 30 minutes. 2. Fry eggplant until golden. 3. Make tomato sauce with garlic and basil. 4. Cook pasta until al dente. 5. Toss pasta with sauce and eggplant. 6. Serve with ricotta salata and basil.
Notes: Named after Bellini's opera Norma. Ricotta salata is essential.

Ingredients: 20 fresh sardines (cleaned), 100g breadcrumbs, 50g pine nuts, 50g raisins, 1 onion (minced), parsley, olive oil, bay leaves
Instructions: 1. Butterfly sardines, remove bones. 2. Mix breadcrumbs, pine nuts, raisins, onion, parsley with oil. 3. Stuff each sardine with mixture. 4. Roll up and secure with toothpick. 5. Arrange in baking dish with bay leaves. 6. Bake at 180°C for 20 minutes.
Notes: Sicilian specialty. Name means sardines like little birds (beccafico).

Ingredients: 300g cannellini beans, 200g ditalini pasta, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 onion (diced), 2 celery stalks (diced), 2 carrots (diced), 1.5L vegetable stock, rosemary, sage, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Soak beans overnight, cook until tender. 2. Sauté vegetables in oil until soft. 3. Add beans with cooking liquid and stock. 4. Simmer 20 minutes, mash some beans to thicken. 5. Add pasta and herbs, cook until al dente. 6. Serve with olive oil drizzle.
Notes: Venetian comfort food. Consistency should be between soup and risotto.

Ingredients: 3kg pork belly with skin, 2 tbsp fennel seeds, 4 cloves garlic (minced), rosemary, sage, salt, pepper, olive oil
Instructions: 1. Score pork skin in crosshatch pattern. 2. Mix fennel seeds, garlic, herbs, salt, pepper with oil. 3. Spread mixture over meat side. 4. Roll tightly and tie with kitchen string. 5. Roast at 200°C for 2-3 hours until crispy. 6. Let rest 30 minutes before slicing.
Notes: Traditional central Italian roast. Skin should be very crispy.

Ingredients: 400g strozzapreti pasta, 500g San Marzano tomatoes, 3 cloves garlic, fresh basil, 100g Parmigiano-Reggiano, olive oil, salt
Instructions: 1. Crush tomatoes by hand, removing seeds. 2. Heat oil, sauté garlic until fragrant. 3. Add tomatoes, cook 20 minutes until thickened. 4. Season with salt and torn basil. 5. Cook pasta until al dente. 6. Toss with sauce and serve with Parmigiano.
Notes: Strozzapreti means priest stranglers. Simple sauce lets pasta shine.

Ingredients: 300g flour, 20g fresh yeast, 4 eggs, 100g butter, 50g sugar, salt, rum syrup (water, sugar, rum)
Instructions: 1. Make yeast dough with flour, yeast, eggs, and salt. 2. Knead in softened butter and sugar. 3. Let rise 2 hours. 4. Bake in individual molds at 180°C for 15 minutes. 5. Make syrup with equal parts water and sugar, add rum. 6. Soak babas in syrup before serving.
Notes: French-influenced Neapolitan dessert. Should be well-soaked but not soggy.

Ingredients: 4 veal cutlets (pounded thin), flour for dusting, 3 tbsp butter, 100ml dry white wine, juice of 2 lemons, parsley, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Season veal with salt and pepper, dust lightly with flour. 2. Heat butter in large pan until foaming. 3. Cook veal 2-3 minutes per side until golden. 4. Remove veal, deglaze pan with wine and lemon juice. 5. Return veal to pan briefly to coat. 6. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.
Notes: Classic northern Italian dish. Don't overcook the delicate veal.

Ingredients: 500g flour, 100g lard, 300ml water, salt, 500g ricotta, 200g sugar, 2 eggs, candied fruit, cinnamon, vanilla
Instructions: 1. Make dough with flour, lard, water, and salt. 2. Roll very thin, brush with lard, roll up. 3. Chill 2 hours. 4. Mix ricotta with sugar, eggs, candied fruit, spices. 5. Cut dough into pieces, shape into cones. 6. Fill with ricotta mixture, bake at 200°C until golden.
Notes: Neapolitan pastry requiring great skill. The layers should be paper-thin.

Ingredients: 4 fish fillets (sea bass or bream), 400g cherry tomatoes, 4 cloves garlic, parsley, oregano, olive oil, white wine, salt, pepper
Instructions: 1. Heat oil in large pan, sauté garlic until fragrant. 2. Add tomatoes, cook until they start to break down. 3. Add fish fillets, season with salt and pepper. 4. Add wine and herbs. 5. Cover and cook 10-15 minutes until fish is cooked. 6. Serve with crusty bread.
Notes: Means crazy water. Simple Neapolitan way to cook fresh fish.

Ingredients: 300g ladyfingers, 500ml milk, 6 egg yolks, 100g sugar, 50g flour, vanilla, rum, chocolate, candied fruit
Instructions: 1. Make pastry cream with milk, egg yolks, sugar, flour, and vanilla. 2. Divide into portions, flavor one with chocolate. 3. Layer rum-soaked ladyfingers with alternating creams. 4. Chill overnight. 5. Decorate with candied fruit before serving.
Notes: Italian trifle. Despite the name (English soup), it's entirely Italian.

Ingredients: 1kg mixed fish and seafood, 400g tomatoes, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, parsley, white wine, olive oil, bread, saffron (optional)
Instructions: 1. Clean and cut fish into portions. 2. Sauté onion and garlic in oil. 3. Add tomatoes, cook 10 minutes. 4. Add firmest fish first, then others by cooking time. 5. Add wine and saffron if using. 6. Simmer until all fish is cooked. 7. Serve with toasted bread.
Notes: Adriatic fish stew. Each port has its own version with local fish.
